Kia ora!

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”2_3,1_3″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ background_color=”rgba(255,255,255,0.8)” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”100%” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_padding=”||||true|true” custom_padding_tablet=”10px|36px|10px|36px|true|true” custom_padding_phone=””][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Quote” _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#636466″ text_font_size=”24px” text_line_height=”30px” hover_enabled=”0″ text_font_size_tablet=”21px” text_font_size_phone=”18px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_line_height_tablet=”” text_line_height_phone=”25px” text_line_height_last_edited=”on|tablet” sticky_enabled=”0″]

Welcome – thanks for visiting our site and engaging in the ‘porn and young people’ conversation. If you’re a health professional, school teacher or youth professional and want to learn more about porn and young people, then you’ve come to the right place…

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text module_class=”col-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default”]

“We are seeking out information about sex but don’t know where to go and end up learning from porn.”
—Anon NZ youth (41)

text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]We can’t look away anymore. We know that young people are looking for a better narrative around sex than porn… Pornography is made by adults and for adults … even the most popular or ‘mainstream’ content can be highly problematic from the perspective of young people learning about sex, sexuality and respectful relationships…”[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.7″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_font_size=”14px” text_line_height=”1.4em” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”12px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”” text_orientation_phone=”left” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|phone”]

— David Shanks, Chief Censor, Classification Office, 2018.
